snippet: Shares of the tech company fell on disappointing earnings, even though it closed a deal to hang onto more of its stake in the Chinese Internet company Alibaba.
abstract: Yahoo announces disappointing second-quarter earnings, with company's revenue falling 4 percent last quarter, to $1.08 billion from year-ago quarter, but says it has reached agreement with Alibaba to reduce number of shares it is required to sell in initial public offering; Yahoo's turnaround, which is tied to its stake in Alibaba, is still work in progress nearly two years after Marissa Mayer has become chief.
lead_paragraph: Shares of the tech company fell on disappointing earnings, even though it closed a deal to hang onto more of its stake in the Chinese Internet company Alibaba.

headline.main: Slump in Advertising Sales Dragged Quarterly Revenue Down at Yahoo
